Episodes.description: Mrs. Krabappel becomes fed up with Bart's lackadaisical approach to his studies. After he bluffs his way through a book report and fails a history exam, she gives him an ultimatum: shape up or repeat the fourth grade.
Episodes.title: Bart Gets an "F"

Episodes.description: Homer lies on a medical insurance form in order to obtain a miracle hair restoring drug.
Episodes.title: Simpson and Delilah

Episodes.description: The Simpsons move into a cursed house, then are abducted by aliens, before Homer is ensconced in a tale by Edgar Allen Poe.
Episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror

Episodes.description: After the power plant experiences bad publicity and is threatened with closure, Mr. Burns decides to run for Governor in order to have power over the law.
Episodes.title: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish

Episodes.description: Homer's heckling of the Springfield Isotopes baseball team during one of their games inadvertently leads to his appointment as the new team mascot.
Episodes.title: Dancin' Homer

Episodes.description: In an attempt to show up Ned Flanders, Homer pits Bart against Ned's son, Todd, in a miniature golf competition.
Episodes.title: Dead Putting Society

Episodes.description: On Thanksgiving, Bart gets into a fight with the family and runs away from home, before sharing a turkey dinner with a group of homeless people at a soup kitchen, and learning the true meaning of the holiday in the process.
Episodes.title: Bart vs. Thanksgiving

Episodes.description: After seeing a motorcycle daredevil at a monster truck show, Bart becomes a death-defying daredevil skateboarder.
Episodes.title: Bart the Daredevil

Episodes.description: Marge becomes a crusader against cartoon violence after watching The Itchy and Scratchy Show.
Episodes.title: Itchy & Scratchy & Marge

Episodes.description: While skateboarding down the street, Bart is hit by a car driven by Mr. Burns. Homer turns down Mr. Burns' token offer of $100, and instead hires ambulance-chaser Lionel Hutz to bring an outrageous lawsuit against the millionaire.
Episodes.title: Bart Gets Hit by a Car

Episodes.description: After apparently consuming poison blowfish, Homer is told that he only has 24 hours to live.
Episodes.title: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish

Episodes.description: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they met and fell in love in high school.
Episodes.title: The Way We Was

Episodes.description: Homer gets a crooked cable guy to install free cable in the Simpson home, and as a result, Lisa faces an ethical crisis over her family's stealing.
Episodes.title: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment

Episodes.description: After attending a co-worker's wedding, Selma begins to fear she will die alone. However, when Homer tries to set her up with Principal Skinner, he falls for Patty instead.
Episodes.title: Principal Charming

Episodes.description: After Grampa is hospitalized, he reveals that Homer has a half-brother, and the family soon discovers the brother, named Herb, owns a car company. However Herb's hiring of Homer to design a new car may be his undoing.
Episodes.title: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?

Episodes.description: After an uncontrollable Santa's Little Helper destroys several important Simpson possessions, Homer announces that he will be thrown out of the house unless he completes obedience training.
Episodes.title: Bart's Dog Gets an F"

Episodes.description: After Grampa's new girlfriend dies and leaves him $106,000 in her will, he tries to decide what to do with it.
Episodes.title: Old Money

Episodes.description: After becoming trapped in a water slide, Homer decides to go on a diet, while Marge enrolls in an art class and is soon commissioned to paint a portrait of Mr. Burns.
Episodes.title: Brush with Greatness

Episodes.description: Lisa has a crush on her substitute teacher, who seemingly represents everything that Homer is not. Meanwhile, Bart decides to run for class president, and becomes the overwhelming favorite.
Episodes.title: Lisa's Substitute

Episodes.description: Homer must decide which is more important: completing counseling to save his marriage or skipping out to catch a legendary catfish. Meanwhile, at home, Bart and Lisa take advantage of Grampa's ignorance of the house rules.
Episodes.title: The War of the Simpsons

Episodes.description: Bart, Milhouse and Martin each pitch in to buy an expensive comic book, which soon has a disastrous effect on their friendship.
Episodes.title: Three Men and a Comic Book

Episodes.description: Bart saves Mr. Burns's life. But Homer becomes enraged when Mr. Burns doesn't return the favor by sending the Simpsons what he considers to be an appropriate "thank you" gift.
Episodes.title: Blood Feud
